From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia


Indian film writer and director (born 1977)


For other people named Raj Kumar Gupta, see Raj Kumar Gupta (disambiguation).
Raj Kumar GuptaRaj Kumar Gupta on the sets of RaidOccupation(s)Director, screenwriter, producerYears active2003–present
Raj Kumar Gupta is an Indian film writer and director, known for his work in Hindi cinema.[1] He made his directorial debut with the critically acclaimed Aamir (2008).[2] He then went on to write and direct No One Killed Jessica (2011),[3] based on the true story of the murder of Jessica Lal which received both commercial and critical acclaim followed by quirky comedy Ghanchakkar that starred Vidya Balan and Emraan Hashmi.[4] In 2018 he directed Raid starring Ajay Devgn which crossed 100 crores.[5]
